sources.ms_copies_score: Leipzig, Musikbibliothek der Stadt, III.12.13 (modern copy)
ms_copies_parts: Berlin, Deutsche Staatsbibliothek, M.577 and M.578. Two copies made in Berlin for Frederick William II
Prague, Národní Muzeum, XXII. B.58, 'Quartetto no. 58...'
Rome, Accademia Santa Cecilia, G. MSS. 357 to 360, dated 1792
sources.first_edition: (c. 1782), Vienna, Artaria: Op. 33 no. 6 (for title, see No. 201)
later_editions: (c. 1782/1785), London, Kerpen: Op. 33 no. 6 (for title, see No. 201)
1785, Paris, Sieber: Op. 33 no. 6 (for title, see No. 201)
1798, Paris, Pleyel: Op. 39 no. 12 (Book 4 no. 3; for title, see No. 234)
modern_edition: (c. 1930?), Leipzig, Peters: Op. 33 no. 6 (separate parts; revised by R. Hofmann). This edition was re-published c. 1943? by the International Music Co., New York
1953, Milan, Ricordi: Op. 33 no. 6 (pocket score; revised by Enrico Polo)

arrangements: Of the fourth movement, as part of a quartet (no. 1) for flute, clarinet, horn and bassoon, by O. Van den Broek, c. 1810 (see No. 262)
Of the second movement, as part of a quartet (no. 3) for flute, clarinet, horn and bassoon, by O. Van den Broek, c. 1810 (see No. 262)
entries.notes: Op. 33 no. 1 of 1781 ('quartettino... opera piccola') in Boccherini's autograph catalogue

partial_notes: This entry contains detailed source information for string quartets, including manuscript copies, editions, and arrangements
